devConsole.codespace_info: A Github Codespace is available to help in development
devConsole.mqtt_topic_info: Omit the 'base_topic', frontend messages are sent over WebSocket directly to Zigbee2MQTT.
devConsole.state_property_info: Set the result into the device's state (only for read)

health.interview_info: Dispositivo interviews can heavily influence this data.

network.begin_info_display: El tipo de visualización permite cambiar entre una vista orientada a datos y una vista de mapa.
network.begin_info_routes: Habilitar rutas recuperará la tabla de rutas de los dispositivos (no todos los coordinadores/dispositivos admiten esto, pero las fallas no deberían impedir que el resto de los datos se carguen). Esto actualmente solo se usa en la visualización de 'datos'.
network.begin_info_type: El tipo se utiliza para recuperar un formato de mapa de red diferente. Los externos están destinados a ser copiados para su uso fuera del frontend (se proporcionan algunos sitios web de ejemplo una vez generados).
network.copy_paste_on: Copie y pegue los siguientes datos en uno de los visualizadores/editores en línea disponibles.
network.highlight_info: Haga clic en la imagen de un dispositivo para resaltarlo automáticamente.
network.legend_edge_toggle: Alternar los bordes de relación cambiará el diseño. Al desactivar uno o más, el diseño real de la red ya no se representa con precisión.
network.legend_node_fold: El botón plegar/expandir del menú contextual del nodo afectará la parte dependiente de la red.
network.legend_node_select: Seleccionar un nodo seleccionará la parte dependiente de un salto de la red.
network.legend_node_siblings: Solo se muestran los hermanos con mayor calificación, que deberían coincidir aproximadamente con las conexiones reales de la red.
network.legend_node_size: Los nodos se dimensionan por centralidad.
network.loading: Dependiendo del tamaño de la red y la calidad de sus enlaces, esto puede tomar un tiempo.

ota.schedule_info: Will update on next OTA request from device
ota.update_selected_info: An OTA update is very taxing for a network. Make sure it is stable and opt for less used times.

settings.donation_text: Aquí puedes agradecernos todo el trabajo duro. No dudes en decir algo agradable también ;)
settings.frontend_notice: Estas configuraciones se almacenan localmente en tu navegador. Usar ventanas privadas o limpiar la caché las restablecerá a los valores predeterminados.
settings.translation_prompt: Puedes ayudar con la traducción en

Home Assistant legacy actions sensor, wh: Home Assistant legacy actions sensor, when enabled a action sensor will be discoverd and an empty `action` will be send after every published action.

The events and attributes are currently: Home Assistant experimental event entities, when enabled Zigbee2MQTT will add event entities for exposed actions. The events and attributes are currently deemed experimental and subject to change.

settingsSchemaDescriptions.Time after which an active device will b: Time after which an active device will be marked as offline in minutes
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Maximum jitter (in msec) allowed on time: Maximum jitter (in msec) allowed on timeout to avoid availability pings trying to trigger around the same time

5, x3, x6, x12.): Enable timeout backoff on failed availability pings (x1.5, x3, x6, x12...)

A value of zero disables pausing: Pause availability pings when backoff reaches over this limit until a new Zigbee message is received from the device. A value of zero disables pausing.

settingsSchemaDescriptions.Options for passive devices (mostly batt: Options for passive devices (mostly battery powered)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Time after which an passive device will: Time after which an passive device will be marked as offline in minutes
settingsSchemaDescriptions.MQTT base topic for Zigbee2MQTT MQTT mes: MQTT base topic for Zigbee2MQTT MQTT messages
settingsSchemaDescriptions.MQTT server URL (use mqtts:// for SSL/TL: MQTT server URL (use mqtts:// for SSL/TLS connection)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate of: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate of CA used to sign server and client certificates
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Absolute path to SSL/TLS key for client-: Absolute path to SSL/TLS key for client-authentication
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate for: Absolute path to SSL/TLS certificate for client-authentication
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Include device information to mqtt messa: Include device information to mqtt messages

AWS IoT core, Azure IoT Hub, Google Clo.Enabling will break the Home Assistant: Disable retain for all send messages. ONLY enable if your MQTT broker doesn't support retained message (e.g. AWS IoT core, Azure IoT Hub, Google Cloud IoT core, IBM Watson IoT Platform). Enabling will break the Home Assistant integration

NOTE: The same value exists in your MQT: Specifies the maximum allowed packet length (in bytes) that the server can send to Zigbee2MQTT. NOTE: The same value exists in your MQTT broker but for the length the client can send to it instead.

Location of the adapter.To autodetect the port, set null: Location of the adapter. To autodetect the port, set null

settingsSchemaDescriptions.Disable LED of the adapter if supported: Disable LED of the adapter if supported
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Adapter type, not needed unless you are: Adapter type, not needed unless you are experiencing problems

This must match what the firmware on yo: Baud rate speed for the serial port. This must match what the firmware on your adapter supports (most commonly 115200).

settingsSchemaDescriptions.RTS / CTS Hardware Flow Control for seri: RTS / CTS Hardware Flow Control for serial port
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Block devices from the network (by ieeeA: Block devices from the network (by ieeeAddr)

Allow only certain devices to join the n.Note that all devices not on the passli: Allow only certain devices to join the network (by ieeeAddr). Note that all devices not on the passlist will be removed from the network!

The value is set in minutes, and the de: Your device may request a check for a new firmware update. This value determines how frequently third party servers may actually be contacted to look for firmware updates. The value is set in minutes, and the default is 1 day.

If you disable these device initiated c: Zigbee devices may request a firmware update, and do so frequently, causing Zigbee2MQTT to reach out to third party servers. If you disable these device initiated checks, you can still initiate a firmware update check manually.

settingsSchemaDescriptions.Location of override OTA index file: Location of override OTA index file

You can increase this value if your net: Limits the rate of requests (in milliseconds) during OTA updates to reduce network congestion. You can increase this value if your network appears unstable during OTA.

Note: This value may get ignored for ma: The size of file chunks sent during an update (in bytes). Note: This value may get ignored for manufacturers that require specific values.

Frontend binding port.Ignored when using a unix domain socket: Frontend binding port. Ignored when using a unix domain socket

Binds to a unix socket when an absolute: Frontend binding host. Binds to a unix socket when an absolute path is given instead.

settingsSchemaDescriptions.URL on which the frontend can be reached: URL on which the frontend can be reached, currently only used for the Home Assistant device configuration page

The sibling property 'ssl_key' must be: SSL Certificate file path for exposing HTTPS. The sibling property 'ssl_key' must be set for HTTPS to be activated.

The sibling property 'ssl_cert' must be: SSL key file path for exposing HTTPS. The sibling property 'ssl_cert' must be set for HTTPS to be activated.

g.'http://localhost:8080/z2m', set this t: Base URL for the frontend. If hosted under a subpath, e.g. 'http://localhost:8080/z2m', set this to '/z2m'

Example: 'z2m: Failed to ping.*': Hide frontend notifications matching specified regex strings. Example: 'z2m: Failed to ping.*'

If true, the frontend UI is not served,: If true, the frontend UI is not served, only the WebSocket is maintained by Zigbee2MQTT (you are required to serve a standalone UI yourself as needed).

settingsSchemaDescriptions.Create symlink to current logs in the lo: Create symlink to current logs in the log directory
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Output location of the log, leave empty: Output location of the log, leave empty to suppress logging
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Log file name, can also contain timestam: Log file name, can also contain timestamp
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Set individual log levels for certain na: Set individual log levels for certain namespaces
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Log debug level to MQTT and frontend (ma: Log debug level to MQTT and frontend (may decrease overall performance)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Do not log these namespaces (regex-based: Do not log these namespaces (regex-based) for debug level
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Number of log directories to keep before: Number of log directories to keep before deleting the oldest one

The host running syslogd, defaults to lo: The host running syslogd, defaults to localhost.

The port on the host that syslog is runn: The port on the host that syslog is running on, defaults to syslogd's default port.

tcp4, udp4, tls4, unix, unix-connect, e: The network protocol to log over (e.g. tcp4, udp4, tls4, unix, unix-connect, etc).

/dev/log or /var/run/syslog for OS X): The path to the syslog dgram socket (i.e. /dev/log or /var/run/syslog for OS X).

pid): PID of the process that log messages are coming from (Default process.pid).

Host to indicate that log messages are c: Host to indicate that log messages are coming from (Default: localhost).

The type of the syslog protocol to use (: The type of the syslog protocol to use (Default: BSD, also valid: 5424).

The name of the application (Default: Zi: The name of the application (Default: Zigbee2MQTT).

The end of line character to be added to: The end of line character to be added to the end of the message (Default: Message without modifications).

settingsSchemaDescriptions.ZigBee pan ID, changing requires re-pair: ZigBee pan ID, changing requires re-pairing all devices!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Zigbee extended pan ID, changing require: Zigbee extended pan ID, changing requires re-pairing all devices!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Zigbee channel, changing might require r: Zigbee channel, changing might require re-pairing some devices! (Note: use a ZLL channel: 11, 15, 20, or 25 to avoid problems)

g.2 for CC2531 or 16 for CC26X2R1) (defau: Adapter concurrency (e.g. 2 for CC2531 or 16 for CC26X2R1) (default: null, uses recommended value)

MQTT message payload will contain all at.Has to be true when integrating via Hom: MQTT message payload will contain all attributes, not only changed ones. Has to be true when integrating via Home Assistant

settingsSchemaDescriptions.Persist cached state, only used when cac: Persist cached state, only used when cache_state: true
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Send cached state on startup, only used: Send cached state on startup, only used when cache_state: true
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Add a last_seen attribute to MQTT messag: Add a last_seen attribute to MQTT messages, contains date/time of last Zigbee message
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Add an elapsed attribute to MQTT message: Add an elapsed attribute to MQTT messages, contains milliseconds since the previous msg
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Network encryption key, changing require: Network encryption key, changing requires re-pairing all devices!
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Transmit power of adapter, only availabl: Transmit power of adapter, only available for Z-Stack (CC253*/CC2652/CC1352) adapters, CC2652 = 5dbm, CC1352 max is = 20dbm (5dbm default)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Examples when 'state' of a device is pub: Examples when 'state' of a device is published json: topic: 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb' payload '{"state": "ON"}' attribute: topic 'zigbee2mqtt/my_bulb/state' payload 'ON' attribute_and_json: both json and attribute (see above)
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Periodically check the health of Zigbee2: Periodically check the health of Zigbee2MQTT

If true, will reset stats every time the: If true, will reset stats every time the health check is executed (only applicable to stats that can be reset).

Used in the MQTT topic of a device.By default this is the device ID: Used in the MQTT topic of a device. By default this is the device ID

settingsSchemaDescriptions.Retain MQTT messages of this device: Retain MQTT messages of this device
settingsSchemaDescriptions.Disables the device (excludes device fro: Disables the device (excludes device from network scans, availability and group state updates)

Sets the MQTT Message Expiry in seconds,.version to 5: Sets the MQTT Message Expiry in seconds, Make sure to set mqtt.version to 5

settingsSchemaDescriptions.QoS level for MQTT messages of this devi: QoS level for MQTT messages of this device

The minimum time between payloads in sec.Payloads received whilst the device is: The minimum time between payloads in seconds. Payloads received whilst the device is being throttled will be discarded

settingsSchemaDescriptions.Protects unique payload values of specif: Protects unique payload values of specified payload properties from overriding within debounce time

Filter attributes with regex from publis: Filter attributes with regex from published payload.

Filter attributes with regex from being: Filter attributes with regex from being added to the cache, this prevents the attribute from being in the published payload when the value didn't change.

(This has no effect if optimistic is se: Filter attributes with regex from optimistic publish payload when calling /set. (This has no effect if optimistic is set to false).

png): The user-defined device icon for the frontend. It can be a full URL link to an image (e.g. https://SOME.SITE/MODEL123.jpg) or a path to a local file inside the `device_icons` directory (e.g. device_icons/MODEL123.png).

settingsSchemaDescriptions.Name of the device in Home Assistant: Name of the device in Home Assistant
settingsSchemaDescriptions.QoS level for MQTT messages of this grou: QoS level for MQTT messages of this group

Control when to publish state OFF or CLO.'all_members_off': only publish state O: Control when to publish state OFF or CLOSE for a group. 'all_members_off': only publish state OFF/CLOSE when all group members are in state OFF/CLOSE,  'last_member_state': publish state OFF whenever one of its members changes to OFF

zigbee.force_remove_notice: Usar solo como último recurso (no se propagará a la red)
zigbee.read_write_attributes: Read / Write attributes from endpoint cluster
